column4: Anyone know the command to start the Network Connections gui as root/sudo?
When I start the GUI as me (from the menu) it doesn't show my network connection
I need to set a static IP, which is much easier from the GUI
edit connections then
I'm already connected via DHCP, but I can't see the connection to edit it
So I assumed that I would be able to see it if I run the GUI as root
right click on the network manager icon and choose edit connections
Yes, done that. My connection doesn't show!
Just an empty list
But I am online, chatting here right now
what is written in /etc/network/interfaces ?
http://pastebin.com/vgqL87v2
I haven't made any changes. New computer 2 months ago and I've never edited the network settings. I just plugged the ethernet cable in when I first switched it on and it worked fine
http://pastebin.com/3q0Gu2dA
and if you dind't play with connections, someone did for you...
won't that knock out my connection?
No, I installed Ubunutu on this machine myself. The only thing network related I edited was the iptables
it shouldn't but then your network-manager should take care of everything
so my network manager will restore the correct settings?
no. it will just manage eth0 which it doesn't do right now
ah ok thanks
anyway from scratch  install  you only have the loopback device in that file
